includedAssets.title: Annie (1982)
includedAssets.synopsis: The legendary John Huston directs this much-loved version of the hit Broadway musical, starring Aileen Quinn as the young orphan who changes the life of munitions billionaire Daddy Warbucks (Albert Finney). With no expense spared from the sets and costumes to the splashy production numbers, and Carol Burnett at her scene-stealing best as the gin-guzzling orphanage crone Miss Hannigan, it all but guarantees that the sun will come out tomorrow.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Classic musical about a young orphan whose life changes overnight when she is taken in by a billionaire.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: The legendary John Huston directs this much-loved version of the hit Broadway musical, starring Aileen Quinn as the young orphan who changes the life of munitions billionaire Daddy Warbucks (Albert Finney). With no expense spared from the sets and costumes to the splashy production numbers, and Carol Burnett at her scene-stealing best as the gin-guzzling orphanage crone Miss Hannigan, it all but guarantees that the sun will come out tomorrow.

includedAssets.title: Matilda
includedAssets.synopsis: Danny DeVito directs this adaptation of Roald Dahl's darkly delicious children's fantasy about the daughter of selfish parents who discovers she has magical powers. Mrs Doubtfire's Mara Wilson is spellbinding as the gifted youngster while Pam 'Where The Heart Is' Ferris terrifies as her child-hating headmistress. DeVito also appears as one of the many monstrous grown-ups, along with his then-wife Rhea Perlman (Carla from Cheers). A delightfully twisted fairy-tale - and not just for kids.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Danny DeVito stars in Roald Dahl's classic tale about a little girl who develops superpowers to cope with her horrible parents and cruel headmistress.
includedAssets.mediumSynopsis: Danny DeVito directs this adaptation of Roald Dahl's darkly delicious children's fantasy about the daughter of selfish parents who discovers she has magical powers. Mrs Doubtfire's Mara Wilson is spellbinding as the gifted youngster while Pam 'Where The Heart Is' Ferris terrifies as her child-hating headmistress. DeVito also appears as one of the many monstrous grown-ups, along with his then-wife Rhea Perlman (Carla from Cheers). A delightfully twisted fairy-tale - and not just for kids.

includedAssets.title: Annie/Matilda
includedAssets.synopsis: The story of two of cinema’s most talented young girls. Annie uses music and kindness to stave off depression-era New York and find a new life, while Matilda uses her incredible brain power to battle her cruel parents and wicked headmistress. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Mara Wilson and Danny DeVito.
includedAssets.shortSynopsis: Two of cinema’s most talented young girls. Annie uses music and kindness to find a new life, while Matilda uses her brain to battle her headmistress.
